SEARCH
Package domain

Class Hay

java.lang.Object
domain.Hay
All Implemented Interfaces:
Unit
public class Hay extends Object implements Unit
The Hay class represents a hay package located inside the valley. Its main behavior is to alternate its color between red and yellow every simulation step (tic-tac). Hay is a static, non-animal unit that visually changes over time to represent growth or decay.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hay

      public Hay(int x, int y, Valley valley)
      Creates a new Hay unit in the given position inside the valley. The hay starts in yellow color.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the hay position.
      y - Y coordinate of the hay position.
      valley - Reference to the valley where the hay is placed.

  • Method Details

    • act

      public void act()
      Executes the hay behavior on each tic-tac (simulation step). Alternates the color between red and yellow.
      Specified by:
      act in interface Unit

      Returns:

    • shape

      public int shape()
      Returns the shape type of this hay unit. Hay is represented as a square.
      Specified by:
      shape in interface Unit
      Returns:
      integer value 2 (square shape).

      Returns the X position (column) of the hay in the valley.

    • getY
